universum.studios.android.setting

Class SettingHeadersAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.widget.BaseAdapter
      • universum.studios.android.widget.adapter.BaseListAdapter<A,VH,I>
        • universum.studios.android.widget.adapter.SimpleListAdapter<SettingHeadersAdapter,ViewHolder,SettingHeadersAdapter.Item>
          • universum.studios.android.setting.SettingHeadersAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Adapter, ListAdapter, SpinnerAdapter, universum.studios.android.widget.adapter.DataSet<SettingHeadersAdapter.Item>, universum.studios.android.widget.adapter.DataSetAdapter<SettingHeadersAdapter,SettingHeadersAdapter.Item>

    public class SettingHeadersAdapter
extends universum.studios.android.widget.adapter.SimpleListAdapter<SettingHeadersAdapter,ViewHolder,SettingHeadersAdapter.Item>
    A SimpleListAdapter implementation used to provide data set of Items for adapter view that displays a list of setting preferences in the context of SettingsBaseActivity.

    This adapter uses the following view types to provide views for its data set of items:

    • VIEW_TYPE_CATEGORY - view for the category header that has no fragment nor intent associated,
    • VIEW_TYPE_CATEGORY_DIVIDER - view for divider between category headers,
    • VIEW_TYPE_HEADER - view for the selectable header.

    Data set of items with associated headers may be supplied via SettingHeadersAdapter(Context, List) constructor or changed via changeHeaders(List). The current data set of transformed items may be obtained via SimpleListAdapter.getItems(). A specific item at a desired position may be obtained via SimpleListAdapter.getItem(int) and its associated header via getItem(int).getHeader().

    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky

      • changeHeaders

        public void changeHeaders(@Nullable
                          List<PreferenceActivity.Header> headers)
        Same as swapHeaders(List) where the old headers are ignored.

      • swapHeaders

        @Nullable
public List<PreferenceActivity.Header> swapHeaders(@Nullable
                                                              List<PreferenceActivity.Header> headers)
        Swaps the current data set of this adapter for the given headers.

        Note, that as this adapter uses multiple view types to present its data set, the specified headers are transformed into data set of Items. The items data set may be obtained via SimpleListAdapter.getItems() or a specific item at a desired position via SimpleListAdapter.getItem(int). Header associated with an item at a specific position may be obtained via getItem(int).getHeader().

        Parameters:
        headers - The headers for which to create a new data set. May be null to clear the current data set.
        See Also:
        changeHeaders(List)

      • swapItems

        @Nullable
public final List<SettingHeadersAdapter.Item> swapItems(@Nullable
                                                                   List<SettingHeadersAdapter.Item> items)
        Overrides:
        swapItems in class universum.studios.android.widget.adapter.SimpleListAdapter<SettingHeadersAdapter,ViewHolder,SettingHeadersAdapter.Item>
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - Use swapHeaders(List) instead.

      • onCreateViewHolder

        @NonNull
protected ViewHolder onCreateViewHolder(@NonNull
                                                  ViewGroup parent,
                                                  int viewType)
        Description copied from class: universum.studios.android.widget.adapter.BaseListAdapter
        Invoked from BaseListAdapter.getView(int, View, ViewGroup) in order to create a view holder along with its corresponding item view for the specified viewType.

        Default implementation of this method assumes presence of AdapterHolder.Factory that has been attached to this adapter via #setHolderFactory(AdapterHolder.Factory). If such factory is available it will be used to create the requested holder otherwise an exception is thrown.

        Overrides:
        onCreateViewHolder in class universum.studios.android.widget.adapter.BaseListAdapter<SettingHeadersAdapter,ViewHolder,SettingHeadersAdapter.Item>
        Parameters:
        parent - A parent view, to resolve correct layout params in case when the item view will be inflated from an Xml layout.
        viewType - Type of the item view to be created with the holder. This is the same identifier as obtained via BaseAdapter.getItemViewType(int) for the position passed to BaseListAdapter.getView(int, View, ViewGroup) method.
        Returns:
        New view holder with the item view of the requested type.
        See Also:
        AdapterHolder.Factory#createHolder(ViewGroup, int), BaseListAdapter.inflateView(int, ViewGroup)

      • onBindViewHolder

        protected void onBindViewHolder(@NonNull
                                ViewHolder viewHolder,
                                int position)
        Description copied from class: universum.studios.android.widget.adapter.BaseListAdapter
        Invoked from BaseListAdapter.getView(int, View, ViewGroup) in order to perform binding of the given viewHolder with data of the item from this adapter's data set at the specified position.

        Default implementation of this method assumes presence of AdapterHolder.Binder that has been attached to this adapter via #setHolderBinder(AdapterHolder.Binder). If such binder is available it will be used to perform binding logic otherwise an exception is thrown.

        Overrides:
        onBindViewHolder in class universum.studios.android.widget.adapter.BaseListAdapter<SettingHeadersAdapter,ViewHolder,SettingHeadersAdapter.Item>
        Parameters:
        viewHolder - The view holder created via BaseListAdapter.onCreateViewHolder(ViewGroup, int) with its corresponding item view to be bound with data.
        position - Position of the item from the current data set of which data should be bound to the view holder.
        See Also:
        AdapterHolder.Binder#bindHolder(Object, AdapterHolder, int, java.util.List)
